newsitem.title: INDIA: India I-Sec sees t-bill yields falling next week.
newsitem.headline: India I-Sec sees t-bill yields falling next week.

text.p: Yields on treasury bills are likely to fall next week, ICICI Securities and Finance Company (I-Sec) said in a debt market commentary on Friday.

"Expectations of overnight call rates for the next reporting fortnight are low and treasury bill yields are likely to fall by 50 to 100 basis points in the second half of January," Aashish Pitale of I-Sec debt research said in a commentary.
It said secondary market yields on treasury bills have remained virtually unchanged over the last fortnight.
Call rates ruling low over an extended period have created an ideal conditions for a crash in treasury bill yields, it said.
"With call rates at below 4.0 percent levels the opportunity to make profits by using 'gapping strategies' will soon be exploited by market participants," it said.
